directions: Place the grape seeds in a cup of water and soak them overnight.
Rinse the soaked seeds and transfer them to a small pot.
Add 1 cup of water to the pot and bring it to a boil.
Simmer the seeds for 10 minutes, then remove from heat and let it cool.
Strain the seeds and discard any remaining water.
Spread the seeds on a clean, moist cloth and place it in a warm area with sunlight.
Keep the cloth moist by misting it with water every few hours.
After 5 days, the sprouted seeds will be ready to plant.
Prepare a pot with well-draining soil and plant the sprouted seeds, covering them lightly with soil.
Place the pot in a sunny location and water the plants regularly.
After about 3 months, the grape vines will start producing fruits.
Harvest the grapes when they are fully ripened and enjoy!
